item.title: humans.txt
item.description: I just added a humans.txt file to this site. I learned about this idea a few weeks back and really liked it! It’s simple, it’s plaintext, and it spits in the face of the subtext of robots.txt being “the internet is for robots (and not for humans).” You can read more about it here. Implementation Details Initially, I tried to “just” make a Page at the top-level of my content (similar to how my about page) is generated, but have hugo produce a text file instead of HTML.

item.title: Implementing a Custom gRPC Resolver
item.description: For the last few years, I have been working on a project within Vitess called VTAdmin1. It’s an operator-friendly API and UI replacement for the older vtcltd UI control panel. item.title: Literate Conway
item.description: About a month ago, I sat down to write a Haskell implementation of Conway’s Game of Life. Taking a literate programming approach, let’s walk through my solution. First things first, let’s make a Cell type: 1 type Cell = Bool This is nothing more than a simple type alias. The Bool type is a natural way to represent the cell, with live cells being True and dead cells being False.
